 JMSB LIFE  Buddy Program 
 The  Buddy Program  is an integral part of the JMSB LIFE initiative. A Buddy is a senior JMSB student who is grouped with first year JMSB international students (mentorees) for one term. 
 Program objectives 
 To assist international students with the transition to university and to Montreal 
 To foster cross-cultural relationships between local and international students 
 To enhance students’ leadership and communication skills 
 See what  JMSB students say  about their buddy experience. 
                    Roles and responsibilities of a buddy
 A Buddy is a point of contact for general inquiries and facilitates the transition to university life by sharing basic knowledge and offering support. 
 A Buddy provides a friendly and familiar face, and helps mentorees transition to their new surroundings and helps establish a sense of belonging. 
 A Buddy projects a positive attitude and encourages  mentorees to become involved in socio-cultural campus activities. 
 A Buddy participates in JMSB LIFE activities throughout the semester, and is a role model and an ambassador to JMSB and the program. 
                    Selection and pairing of buddies
 Students who wish to become a Buddy must complete the Buddy application form as well as  meet certain criteria . 
 Buddies will be introduced to their mentorees at the orientation sessions that take place before each term. The 2017-18 orientations will take place on August 29 & 30, 2017 (FALL) and on January 4, 2018 (WINTER). 
 Emphasis is placed on grouping Buddies and mentorees who are in the same program of study. 
                    Buddy Criteria
 In order to be selected as a Buddy, a student must: 
 Be willing to commit to a full semester of participation in JMSB LIFE activities 
 Have a cumulative GPA over 2.7 
 Take pride in Concordia and JMSB 
 Be friendly, personable and dependable 
 Demonstrate cross-cultural awareness and be a positive role model 
 Be available to attend a half-day training session one week prior to the orientation 
                    Benefits of being a Buddy
 Engage in community service 
 Make cross-cultural connections 
 Develop leadership and mentorship skills 
                    Training
 A half-day training session will take place prior to both the Fall and Winter term orientations.  
 Buddy training for the fall orientaiton will take place on Monday, August 28 from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m in room MB 4.206. 
                    Certificate of Recognition
 At the end of a Buddies mandate, he/she will be invited to the Dean’s Buddy Recognition cocktail where they will receive a Certificate of Recognition for their contribution to JMSB LIFE.  
 The Buddy Program qualifies for the   CCR - Co-Curricular Record .   As such, all participants will have the entry marked on their transcripts indicating their volunteerism in this valuable activity.  
 Questions? 
 Send an email to  jmsb.life@concordia.ca . 
 How to apply 
 Interested? Fill out the on-line form! 
 Application deadlines 
 July 31, 2017  for  Fall 2017 
 November 13, 2017  for  Winter 2018
